subclusters.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
Autophagy Decline and Mitochondrial Dysfunction Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic control and programming of senescence via specific genes and chromosomes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic programming and dominance of senescence phenotype controlled by limited genes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic regulation of senescence genes (INK4/ARF locus) by ANRIL, linking genetic control to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes loss of progenitor cells and differentiation as a genetically influenced program contributing to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Suggests genetic/meristem intrinsic control of aging in trees analogous to programmed cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: MAPK pathway dysregulation as a genetically regulated signaling mechanism driving cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as a coordinated phenotype from genetic signaling pathways balancing expansion and arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetically Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Cell death program as a genetically encoded mechanism contributing to aging and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell antigen (band 3 protein) as a molecular marker triggering immune clearance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes immune evasion of senescent cells via inhibitory immune checkpoints preventing clearance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details CK2 down-regulation activating NF-κB signaling to induce SASP, linking molecular regulation to immune signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: SASP-induced CD38 expression links senescence secretome to metabolic decline, a molecular marker-driven mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation, SASP, and therapeutic targeting (senolytics) highlighting molecular markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes SASP and senescent cell accumulation as causal drivers of NAFLD, emphasizing molecular secretory phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescent cell accumulation, SASP, and stem cell interaction as molecular and immune-related aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence as a multifunctional stress response with SASP mediating diverse molecular and immune effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details replicative and stress-induced senescence with SASP contributing to kidney aging, emphasizing molecular markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links stable cell cycle arrest and SASP to vascular aging and microaneurysm formation, focusing on molecular markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence, tumor suppressor pathways, and SASP in vascular aging, emphasizing molecular mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: COPD as accelerated cellular senescence with telomere attrition and SASP-related molecular pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Microglial replicative senescence with telomere-dependent and independent mechanisms, focusing on molecular and functional markers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative and postmitotic senescence with genomic instability and tumor suppressor pathways as molecular drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence, SASP, and paracrine senescence amplifying tissue dysfunction via molecular signals.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Molecular Marker and Immune Recognition Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Senescent fibroblasts impair wound healing via SASP and inflammation, highlighting molecular secretory phenotype effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation in white adipose tissue and SASP driving inflammageing and metabolic dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-induced oxidative stress causing endothelial dysfunction mediated by SASP and telomere shortening.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Tissue Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: ROS-mediated senescence activates tumor suppressors and SASP, linking oxidative stress to senescence phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Mitochondrial Dysfunction Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in autophagy and mitophagy leading to accumulation of damaged mitochondria and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Mitochondrial Dysfunction Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in autophagic proteolysis impairing cellular maintenance and promoting aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nucleolus-Centered Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes nucleolus and rDNA locus as central regulators of cellular senescence and aging mechanisms.
